metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data of Daggyai Co mafic intrusive rocks in the Gangdise arc, southern Tibet
metadata.description: This data set includes the data of major and trace elements of whole rock, major and trace elements of minerals, whole rock SR – Nd isotopes and zircon u – Pb ages of gabbros and their enclaves. The samples were collected from gabbros and xenoliths in dajiacuo area, Lhasa block, southern Tibet. Zircon U-Pb dating data were obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The major and trace geochemical data of the whole rock are obtained by X-ray fluorescence spectrometry and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The data of major elements in minerals are obtained by electron probe analysis, and the data of trace elements in minerals are obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The whole rock SR – Nd isotopes were obtained by sample separation and purification multi receiver inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS). Through the data obtained, we can define the age, origin and deep dynamic mechanism of magmatism in the region, and provide an understanding of amphibole differentiation process of arc magma.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file. The file name "zirupb. XLS" represents zircon U-Pb geochronology data. The name of the file "wrmajtraiso" represents the major, trace and isotopic geochemical data of the whole rock. The name of the file is "minmaj", which represents the data of mineral major elements. The file name "mintra" represents mineral trace element data.

literatureList.titleEn: The role of clinopyroxene in amphibole fractionation of arc magmas: Evidence from mafic intrusive rocks within the Gangdese arc, southern Tibet

The role of clinopyroxene in amphibole fractionation of arc magmas: Evidence from mafic intrusive rocks within the Gangdese arc, southern Tibet. Lithos, 338-339, 174-188. doi:10.1016/j.lithos.2019.04.013

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to obtain geochemical data from mafic intrusive rocks, including whole-rock major and trace elements, mineral major and trace elements, and isotopic compositions?
Example.Answer: In the field of studying mafic intrusive rocks such as gabbros and their enclaves from the Dajiacuo area in southern Tibet, geochemical data collection methods include using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb age data, X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF) and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for whole-rock major and trace elements, electron probe microanalysis (EPMA) for mineral major element data, and LA-ICP-MS for mineral trace element data. Additionally, whole-rock Sr–Nd isotopic compositions are obtained through sample separation and purification followed by multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC-ICP-MS) analysis.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics and methods used for collecting and analyzing geochemical data from mafic intrusions in the region of Southern Tibet?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace elements, mineral major and trace elements, whole-rock Sr–Nd isotopes, zircon U–Pb age data

Quantification.Question: How many types of isotopic data are collected in a dataset related to gabbroic and its enclaves from the Lhasa block in southern Tibet?

Definition.Question: What does 'laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry' mean in the context of geochemical data collection?
Definition.Answer: Laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) is a technique used to analyze zircon U-Pb ages and mineral trace elements by ablating a small part of the sample with a laser and then measuring the isotopes and elements using a mass spectrometer.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting geochemical data, including major and trace elements, isotopic compositions, and zircon U-Pb ages from mafic intrusions in the context of studying arc magmatism and its underlying dynamics?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to constrain the age and origin of magmatic activities, understand the deep dynamic mechanisms within the region, and provide insights into the amphibole differentiation process in arc magmatism.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What instrumental and procedural approaches are utilized to collect and analyze geochemical data of mafic intrusions and their enclaves in the Lhasa block region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The geochemical data of mafic intrusions and their enclaves in the Lhasa block region are collected and analyzed using several instrumental methods: zircon U-Pb ages are determined through laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS); whole-rock major and trace geochemical data are obtained using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS); mineral major element data are acquired via electron probe microanalysis (EPMA); mineral trace element data are also collected using LA-ICP-MS; and whole-rock Sr–Nd isotopes are analyzed through sample separation and purification followed by multi-collector ICP-MS analysis. These methods together help in constraining the timing, origin, and deep dynamic mechanisms of magmatism in the region, providing insights into the amphibole differentiation processes in arc magmatism.
